result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
8:18 AM Defendant Kyle J. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kyle J. Johnson.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case. 
Court reviews competency report filed on July 26, 2022. 
ADA confirms that she has reviewed. 
Atty has reviewed along with deft. 
Deft non-competent to proceed and unlikely to regain.
ADA does not object to findings but unsure of how to proceed. 
Has reached out to corporation counsel. 
Court accepts the report in lieu of testimony. 
No objections. 
Court enters orders that deft is not competent and unlikely to regain. 
Atty spks on options available for the deft. 
ADA responds. 
Camille Grutza discusses plan for deft under juvenile guardianship. 
Dept does not believe that the deft should return to the care of the guardian. 
Spks on attempts to obtain long term treatment for deft- Chippewa Falls. 
Parties discuss. 
Court spks- deft to remain in custody and a probable cause hearing to be scheduled-EM1 procedure to be followed by the Marinette County Sherrif's Department. 
8:31 AM

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle J. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kyle J. Johnson. 
Court calls case. 
ADA spks- report has not been filed. 
Atty agrees. 
Court schedules with parties. 
9:24 AM
Competency hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

8:50 AM Prosecuting Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Kyle J. Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kyle J. Johnson. 
Court calls case. 
Atty spks on competency motion. 
Makes finding of probable cause- Competency Examination.
Court schedules with parties. 
Atty spks on bond. 
ADA responds. 
Court denies request- bail to remain with previously set conditions. 
8:55 AM
Competency hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:15 PM Defendant Kyle J. Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft heard and would like an attorney.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
DA heard on possible housing for the Deft if he was released.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $1,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no contact with L.O. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
1:20 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
